Hindu festivals like Diwali & Maha Kumbh Mela likely cause more traffic trouble in India due to massive processions, shopping rushes, & travel, e.g., a 300 km jam during Kumbh. Muslim festivals like Eid al-Fitr see congestion near mosques & travel peaks, but it’s more localized.

World's biggest traffic Jam - 300km congestion!

During the Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 in Prayagraj, India witnessed a record-breaking 300 km-long traffic jam, stranding vehicles for up to 48 hours. The massive congestion, mainly affecting routes through Madhya Pradesh, was caused by an overwhelming influx of pilgrims.
